name: Compound Microscope Case (caisse)
maker: Micrometric stage invented by Michel-Ferdinand d'Albert d'Ailly, sixth duke of Chaulnes
description: Compound Microscope Case (caisse); Micrometric stage invented by Michel-Ferdinand d'Albert d'Ailly, sixth duke of Chaulnes (French, 1714 - 1769); Paris, France; about 1751; Wood; gilded leather; brass closing fixtures; original lining of silk velvet with silver braid and lace; slides of various natural specimens and brass implements; 66 × 34.9 × 27 cm (26 × 13 3/4 × 10 5/8 in.); 86.DH.694.2; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
title: Compound Microscope Case (caisse)
medium: Wood; gilded leather; brass closing fixtures; original lining of silk velvet with silver braid and lace; slides of various natural specimens and brass implements
